p.span: KCPS is an anchor organization that creates an environment of academic excellence through a collaborative, equitable and rigorous learning community.

div.span: The 2020 vision, mission and strategic plan reflects the critical priorities and distraict goals for educating students within the Kent County Public School System.

span.div: Children's Mental Health Awareness Week is May 3-9, 2020. Attached is a monthly calendar with helpful tips for fostering resilience in your child.

span.div: The next set of PreK-5 learning packets are now available to download from our district website.

COVID-19 Technology Device Distribution and Insurance Payments

span.div: Payments for the $10 Technology Insurance for devices can be made through MySchoolBucks or by check mailed to KCPS c/o Terri Smith, 5608 Boundary Ave, Rock Hall, MD 21661

Kent County Public Schools will be distributing free breakfast snacks, lunch meals, and supper meals at multiple locations throughout Kent County, Monday through Friday between 11:30am and 1:00pm. Read more for updated lists.

br.span: Read More for a list of Kent County HotSpots that are available. For a map of HotSpots near your area please visit http://www.Kenthotspots.com

span.span: We are writing to provide you with information about the coronavirus and our district's efforts to ensure the well-being of all students.

div.a: From the Office of the Superintendent

span.span: The Kent County Public Schools promotes a safe and orderly atmosphere in all our schools and will not tolerate anyone who engages in bullying or harassment motivated by ethnicity, race, religion, sexual-orientation, or gender identity.

div.a: Maryland Special Education Parent Involvement Survey

span.p: The purpose of this Survey is to determine how well your child’s school is partnering with you and promoting parent involvement in your child’s education. Click the "Read More" tab for more information, including the MD SPED survey.
